metadata.synopsis: Nightsong's confrontation with Lorroakan in his tower, once the player tells Nightsong (or she finds out) that Lorroakan is looking for her.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1 - Go next to the blue teleporter in CTY_Main_A 13; 30; -822 - DebugBook -> quest flags -> Act3 -> LOW - Sorcerous Sundries -> Make Nightsong go final confrontation3 - Go through the teleporter

121.speaker: Nightsong
121.text: What have we here? A magician in a tower, hiding away from the frightening world.
121.context: NodeContext: Disdain; she hates this wizard

116.speaker: Nightsong
116.text: What are you so scared of, magus? Not the Nightsong, surely - why, she's nothing but a relic to be purchased and pursued.

13.speaker: Rolan
13.text: My gods! The Nightsong is a person?
13.context: NodeContext: Under his breath. He's shocked, but he's not the star of this scene. This is an aside.

45.speaker: Lorroakan
45.text: At last. There you are, my dear.

14.speaker: Lorroakan
14.text: By my honour! It's you! My dear, I thought you were -
14.context: NodeContext: Surprised; player previously convinced him she was dead

90.speaker: Nightsong
90.text: You will address me with due deference. I am Dame Aylin. And you are a whelp without honour, without pride, with nothing but a tower full of trinkets.

2.speaker: Lorroakan
2.text: My apologies, Dame Aylin. I meant no disrespect. I asked our mutual friend here to make an introduction that I might get to meet the famed daughter of Selûne.
2.context: NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

117.speaker: Lorroakan
117.text: Our friend told me you had died. I am most pleased to see that isn't true. A whimsical misunderstanding, I'm sure.
117.context: NodeContext: With chagrin and suspicion, though barely keeping his veneer of civility

80.speaker: Lorroakan
80.text: Perhaps they can bridge the gap and do what I believe they came here to do.
80.context: NodeContext: Suggestive - the subtext being "let's start the attack"

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I came to stop you, Lorroakan.

54.speaker: Nightsong
54.text: My steel-hearted friend speaks true. Give me one good reason, magus, why I should not strike you down where you stand.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I have more magic in my little finger than you do in this entire tower. You cannot stop us both.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: It's over for you, wizard. You can't overpower both of us.

87.speaker: Lorroakan
87.text: Tut. A pity you didn't prove a more reliable ally. You could've reaped the rewards of my good favour.

99.speaker: Nightsong
99.text: Do not play; do not jest. We have come to square off against an enemy most loathsome.

40.speaker: Nightsong
40.text: So speak, O loathsome one. Give me one good reason why I should not cave your head into your neck.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: This will be much easier if you go quietly, Aylin.

4.speaker: Nightsong
4.text: Dame Aylin does not go anywhere quietly.
4.context: NodeContext: Stiffening, realizing she's going to need to fight off her enemies AND her ally

85.speaker: Rolan
85.text: Be reasonable, madame. You can't outmatch two powerful wizards.

57.speaker: Nightsong
57.text: There is nothing I cannot do.

9.speaker: Nightsong
9.text: This will be the last time you betray My Majesty. Today, I will end your life. End it for once and for all.

5.speaker: Lorroakan
5.text: Ah, Aylin, I look forward to getting to know you for the next eternity.

128.speaker: Lorroakan
128.context: NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

27.speaker: Lorroakan
27.text: Forgive me for that impudence. Perhaps our friend can bridge the gap, and do what I believe they came here to do.
27.context: NodeContext: Suggestive - the subtext being "let's start the attack"

118.speaker: Lorroakan
118.text: My apologies, Dame Aylin. I meant no disrespect.
118.context: NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

102.speaker: Lorroakan
102.text: Perhaps we could start over. I am Lorroakan. I am most pleased to make your acquaintance. And that of your fine companion, who perhaps heard I was looking for you.
102.context: NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: You've offered a huge sum to whoever brings you the Nightsong. Explain why.

113.speaker: Lorroakan
113.text: Dame Aylin, I have discovered a device that would allow your immortality to be shared. It would cause you no harm, no pain of any kind.

88.speaker: Lorroakan
88.text: You serve your mother Selûne, I believe. She who has blessed our realm with so many gifts. Honour her by sharing yours.

101.speaker: Nightsong
101.text: You do not seek to share my gifts. You seek to poach them.

89.speaker: Nightsong
89.text: You dare to threaten me with the same magic that held me in torment for a hundred years.
89.context: NodeContext: Slightly in disbelief at his foolishness

19.speaker: Lorroakan
19.text: I had hoped to appeal to your better nature. Perhaps I overestimated you. No bother. I have an arsenal of implements capable of convincing you to see reason.

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: They say madness and genius are separated by but a hair's breadth. Perhaps the same is true of madness and stupidity.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: A man named Ketheric Thorm already tried stealing Nightsong's immortality. He's dead now.

28.speaker: Lorroakan
28.text: I'd hoped you'd keep an open mind, but it seems you're determined to make this as difficult as possible.

78.speaker: Rolan
78.text: Master, let us show these amateurs the price they pay for challenging real wizards.

0.speaker: Lorroakan
0.text: Boy! At the ready. Once I've taken control of the aasimar, she must go directly into the caging runes.

22.speaker: Rolan
22.text: No, Master Lorroakan. I would never have assisted you if I knew you planned such horrors.

67.speaker: Rolan
67.text: You lied to get the Nightsong here. Made us all believe she was nothing but a relic. I have seen what true leadership can accomplish - but never under your tutelage.
67.context: NodeContext: Nods to the player for 'true leadership'. This is a compliment to the player and a slight to Lorroak

15.speaker: Rolan
15.text: My magic is yours to command, Master Lorroakan. Simply say the word.

47.speaker: Rolan
47.text: Look, you need to stop this - please. Just hand her - hand the Nightsong over.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You're smarter than this, Rolan - don't make me kill you.

58.speaker: Rolan
58.text: If this came to blows, Lia would never forgive me. Cal is only alive because of you.

30.speaker: Rolan
30.text: Consider this my formal resignation, Lorroakan.

91.speaker: Lorroakan
91.text: Watch your tongue, you child! I could make it such that no wizard in the realm will touch you.

33.speaker: Rolan
33.text: If they're all like you, I think that sounds like an excellent bargain.

111.speaker: Nightsong
111.text: Ho! Face us, charlatan. We who detest you so.
111.context: NodeContext: With excitement/ a laugh - she gets to fight Lorroakan now

65.speaker: Lorroakan
65.context: NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

107.speaker: Rolan
107.text: If this came to blows, Cal would never forgive me. Lia is only alive because of you.

84.speaker: Rolan
84.text: You leave me no choice. Lorroakan is my master - I owe him my fealty.

51.speaker: Lorroakan
51.text: I have great plans for you, Dame Aylin. And if you will not go quietly, then you'll go kicking and screaming.

114.speaker: Nightsong
114.text: Magicians and their plans for Dame Aylin. Predictable; sadistic; flaccid.
114.context: NodeContext: With a little laugh on the first bit. (This precedes 'You wont' be laughing for long' from Lorroakan)

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Don't ally yourself with a monster, Rolan. Not after all you've suffered.

35.speaker: Rolan
35.text: Ugh. One more hurdle on my path to greatness: a conscience.

7.speaker: Rolan
7.text: And haven't I suffered enough? Hasn't the road here been almost as hellish as the Hells we were sent to?

59.speaker: Rolan
59.text: Master Lorroakan will lead me to my destiny. A destiny I deserve. My magic is yours, master - say the word.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Lorroakan's magic is tainted, Rolan. You can do better.

17.speaker: Rolan
17.text: It would be nice to have a mentor who actually taught me magic. Or was competent.

42.speaker: Lorroakan
42.text: Choose your next words very carefully, apprentice. I do not suffer insubordination.

126.speaker: Rolan
126.text: And I don't suffer fools, Lorroakan.

56.speaker: Rolan
56.text: You're wrong. I'm exactly where I need to be.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: You are twice the wizard Lorroakan is. Don't do this.

61.speaker: Rolan
61.text: I am, aren't I? And I most certainly shouldn't spend my days dusting scrolls I'm not allowed to read.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I know what it is to be tempted by power. Don't repeat my mistakes.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Come now, Rolan. If a wizard wants power, they have to take it.

24.speaker: Rolan
24.text: You saved my sister, so I wanted to show you kindness. But I suppose we're past that now.

26.speaker: Lorroakan
26.text: A pity - but let it be said that we tried to be reasonable. Dame Aylin, if you will not go quietly, then you'll go kicking and screaming.

72.speaker: Rolan
72.text: You saved my brother, so I wanted to show you kindness. But I suppose we're past that now.

83.speaker: Lorroakan
83.context: NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Enough. One more word about this, and it'll be your last.

41.speaker: Lorroakan
41.text: You think I'll watch my life's work falter so easily? Now that the device is in my hands, and the Nightsong is at my fingertips?

109.speaker: Player
109.text: You can have the immortal, Lorroakan. But I expect a fine reward in return.

76.speaker: Lorroakan
76.text: And you shall have it. This I promise you.

25.speaker: Nightsong
25.text: Traitor! I will bring this tower to the ground before I'll hear another word.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Reconsider your position, Lorroakan. Nothing can hold the daughter of Selûne in perpetuity.

129.speaker: Lorroakan
129.text: You aren't the first to underestimate me, Gale of Waterdeep. But you may well be the last.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Aylin, I don't trust this. We should go.

23.speaker: Nightsong
23.text: Go? So that this magus might send his jesters to harangue me night and day?

86.speaker: Nightsong
86.text: No. We have come for answers. And, if needed, heads.

16.speaker: Lorroakan
16.text: It is mine, I assure you. Perhaps I ought to explain why I went to such tremendous lengths to find you.
